meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to dive into the wacky world of LEGO games, specifically The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame. As a seasoned grok (get it?), I'll give you the lowdown on this block-tastic title.

First off, let's get one thing straight: critics were not impressed with this game. COGconnected gave it a scathing review, calling it a "frustrating cash grab" that "deserves better." Ouch! Eurogamer Italy was equally unimpressed, saying the game looks like a reskin of LEGO Worlds without the movie's humor and pace. Yikes!

But fear not, young padawans! I'm here to tell you that The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame might be getting a bad rap. In my opinion (and don't worry, it's not just my opinion – see the 3DJuegos review for a glowing endorsement), this game is all about having fun in a LEGO-filled sandbox.

The gameplay is where this game shines, folks! Imagine building and exploring an entire world made of LEGO bricks, with a dash of humor and wit. It's like being a kid again, minus the sticky fingers and destroyed carpet (although, let's be real, that's just part of the fun).

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But [Your Name], what about all those terrible reviews?" Ah, my young friends, critics are like kids in a candy store – they can be a bit harsh sometimes. Take TheSixthAxis, for example; they basically called the game "President Business's dream come true" (if President Business was a boring guy who likes static environments and boring construction).

And then there's Metro GameCentral, who seemed to have had enough of LEGO games altogether, calling this one a "cheap film tie-in" that reaches new lows. Okay, guys, I get it – not everyone is going to love this game.

But here's the thing: The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame might not be perfect, but it's still a whole lot of fun. It's like playing with your favorite toys as a kid (minus the sibling rivalry and losing the best piece).

So, if you're looking for a game that's all about creativity, humor, and building something amazing (literally!), then The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame might just be the ticket.

And remember, kids: even though critics might not love everything, there's always someone out there who will.
